%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
% Commands and Environments for resume
 
% A horizontal rule for sections
\newcommand{\HRule}[2]{\textcolor{#1}{\rule{\linewidth}{#2}}}
 
% A section tile command
\newcommand{\sectiontitle}[1]{\begin{minipage}{\textwidth}\HRule{black}{0.25mm}\vspace{-10pt}\begin{center}\Large\MakeUppercase{#1}\end{center}\end{minipage}\\\HRule{light-grey}{0.15mm}\vspace{\baselineskip}}
 
% An environment for a resume section
\newenvironment{ressection}[1]{
  \sectiontitle{#1}}{\vspace{-\baselineskip}}
 
% A ressection that has to be on one page, awards, education etc
\newenvironment{tightressection}[1]{
  \begin{minipage}{\textwidth}
  \sectiontitle{#1}}
  {\vspace{\baselineskip}\end{minipage}}
 
% A column if there is a two columned section such as in awards
\newenvironment{rescolumn}{
  \begin{minipage}{0.5\textwidth}
    \begin{itemize}[noitemsep,nolistsep]}
  {\end{itemize}
    \end{minipage}}
 
% A resitem is a simple list element
\newcommand{\resitem}[1]{
    \vspace{2pt}
    \item \begin{flushleft} #1 \end{flushleft}
}

% A resitem is a simple list element
\newcommand{\resitemcenter}[1]{
    \vspace{2pt}
    \item #1
}
 
% An entry for memberships
% Arg1: Board
% Arg2: Position
% Arg3: Date
\newcommand{\boardentry}[3]{
  \begin{minipage}{\textwidth}
  \vspace{-9pt}
  \textbf{#1}\\
  \textit{#2}, \textit{#3}\\
  \vspace{0.5\baselineskip}
  \end{minipage}
}
 
 
% An entry for education
% Arg1: Institution
% Arg2: Program
% Arg3: Dates
\newcommand{\resedentry}[4]{
  \begin{minipage}{\textwidth}
  \vspace{-10pt}
  \textbf{#1}\\
  \textit{#2}\hfill\textcolor{light-grey}{#3}\\
  #4
  \vspace{0.5\baselineskip}
  \end{minipage}
}
 
% Resentry defines a position
% Arg1: Position title
% Arg2: Company or Office---Company
% Arg3: Location, PROV
% Arg4: Date Range
\newcommand{\resentryheader}[5]{
    \vspace{-5pt}
    \textbf{#1}\hspace{\stretch{1}}\textcolor{light-grey}{#3}\\
    \textit{#2}\hspace{\stretch{1}}\textcolor{light-grey}{#4}\\
    \if\relax\detokenize{#5}\relax
    \else
      #5\\
    \fi
    \vspace{2pt}
}
 
% This is a resume entry with a header and bullet items
\newenvironment{resentry}[5]{
  \begin{minipage}{\textwidth}
    \resentryheader{#1}{#2}{#3}{#4}{#5}
        \vspace{-\baselineskip}
    \begin{itemize}[noitemsep,nolistsep]
}{
    \end{itemize}
        \vspace{\baselineskip}
        \end{minipage}
}

% This is a header for creating sub entries
\newenvironment{ressubentry}[1]{
  \begin{minipage}{\textwidth}
    \resitem{\textbf{#1}}
    \begin{itemize}[noitemsep,nolistsep]
}{
    \end{itemize}
        \end{minipage}
}
 
 
%%%%%%%%%%%%
% Begin The Resume
 

\makeatother

\begin{document}
\begin{tabularx}{\linewidth}{X r}

\end{tabularx}

\begin{ressection}{experience}

\begin{resentry}{Senior Software Engineer}{ProviderScience}{Dallas,
TX}{October 2015 --- January 2016}{At ProviderScience, I was brought
in to plan and develop the prediction engine that powers the ProviderScience
product.} 

\begin{ressubentry}{Predictive Data Science}

\resitem{Developed system to predict the required amount of personnel
needed to staff a pharmacy over the next two weeks.} 

\resitem{Engineered the data flow from data dropping into the ftp
server into a non-relational database.} 

\resitem{Processed the data in the non-relational database into a
format that could be used for training Machine Learning algorithms.} 

\resitem{Tested multiple machine learning algorithms and settled
on a Decision Forest as the best algorithm for the data.}

\end{ressubentry} 

\begin{ressubentry}{Big Data Analytics}

\resitem{Explored the data provided by clients and provided insight
into how the data could be used.}

\end{ressubentry} 

\end{resentry}

\begin{resentry}{Senior Software Engineer}{Gwynn Group, Inc}{Dallas,
TX}{February 2015 --- October 2015}{I was brought into Gwynn Group
as a Full Stack Engineer and developed new features across the entire
stack.} 

\begin{ressubentry}{Data Visualization}

\resitem{Used D3 to create interactive charts and reports.} 

\resitem{Developed charts to be modular and user configurable.} 

\end{ressubentry} 

\begin{ressubentry}{Predictive Analytics}

\resitem{Created a forecast engine that could predict any time-series
metric.} 

\resitem{Used Triple Exponential Smoothing to predict values with
seasons and trends.} 

\resitem{Used the forecast engine to create alerts when the metric.} 

\end{ressubentry} 

\begin{ressubentry}{Big Data Analytics}

\resitem{Engineered queries for performance that executed over billions
of records.} 

\resitem{Built and designed reports to help clients gain insight
into data that was spread over multiple systems.}

\end{ressubentry} 

\end{resentry}

\begin{resentry}{Software Developer II}{Allegro Development}{Dallas,
TX}{August 2013 --- February 2015}{At Allegro Development, I was
hired on to help start a new team, the Innovation Team. The team created
new products, improved current applications and taught development
practices to the development team.} 

\begin{ressubentry}{Business Intelligence Portal}

\resitem{Developed and delivered a new Business Intelligence Portal
using C\#, MVC5 and SQL Server.} 

\resitem{Used Entity Framework to manage data models and database
migrations.} 

\resitem{Created over twenty BI reports using Tableau.} 

\resitem{Developed data sync tool to keep Oracle and MS SQL Server
in sync using an ETL process.}

\end{ressubentry} 

\begin{ressubentry}{Application Installer}

\resitem{Created an Application Installer to simplify the process
of installing the Allegro application.} 

\resitem{Used WiX to set up IIS and configure the application correctly.} 

\end{ressubentry} 

\begin{ressubentry}{Build Process}

\resitem{Completely rewrote the build process to speed up build time
by 4x.} 

\resitem{New build process is much more reliable and follows industry
standards using MSBuild and C\#.}

\end{ressubentry} 

\end{resentry}

\begin{resentry}{Programmer}{OneStepRemoved.com}{Dallas, TX}{May
2012 --- August 2013}{At OneStepRemoved, I was selected to work
on an internal research and development project to create a currency
trading system. Throughout this project, I worked as the lead designer
and sole developer. It has been a great opportunity to test myself
in all aspects of programming and software engineering.} 

\begin{ressubentry}{Software Engineering}

\resitem{Implemented Test Driven Development procedures for use on
the project. These procedures drove development and the resulting
unit tests were continually useful.} 

\resitem{Designed the architecture of the currency trading application
to be modular and robust, using established software engineering principles
in C\#. }

\resitem{Designed an API that can be used to plug in several different
online currency market trading services} 

\resitem{Developed client-server model with login authentication} 

\end{ressubentry} 

\begin{ressubentry}{Scientific Programming/Machine Learning}

\resitem{Evaluated several learning technologies and selected Neural
Networks as the means of learning to predict future market condition
for currency trading} 

\resitem{Created both supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms
for neural networks (Genetic Algorithm, Levenberg-Marquardt, Resilient
Propagation, to name a few)}

\resitem{Designed the application to be run without human interaction,
including developing logic to automatically retrain the neural network
and transition it to online use in real time}

\end{ressubentry} 

\begin{ressubentry}{Security}

\resitem{Implemented a procedure to authenticate connections in a
client-server architecture} 

\resitem{Used RSA encryption to send encrypted messages from the
server to clients} 

\end{ressubentry}

\begin{ressubentry}{Distributed Networking} 

\resitem{Designed and implemented a secure networking implementation
in a server/client infrastructure}

\resitem{Developed a parallel processing system for training Neural
Networks that ran on a 12-core computer, cutting training time from
2 days to 30 seconds}

\end{ressubentry}

\end{resentry}

\begin{resentry}{Proctor}{CS Department --- University of Texas
at Austin}{Austin, TX}{August 2010 --- May 2012}{}

\resitem{Directed a discussion section of 20 to 30 students every
week for a UT Logic class} 

%    \resitem{Graded weekly homework assignments and monthly tests} 

\resitem{Taught programming skills in Python to 50 students} 

\resitem{Developed scripts to grade students' programming assignments} 

\resitem{Tutored programming theory and skills in Python and Java} 

\end{resentry}

\begin{resentry}{Student Developer}{Institute for Human and Machine
Cognition}{Pensacola, FL}{May 2010 --- August 2010}{} 

\resitem{Developed a web-based server to collect, display, and stream
experiment data collected from an aircraft instrument simulation}

\resitem{Server allowed multiple clients to view the same information
at the same time}

\resitem{Server displayed statistics and graphs for user selected
experimental variables during the ongoing experiment} 

\resitem{Previously stored experiment data could be displayed and
streamed to the aircraft instrument} 

\end{resentry} 

\end{ressection}
